FuncDef: The reboot command is used to reboot a device.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The function of the reboot command is the same as powering off and on a device, but this command facilitates remote device maintenance.
Precautions
Confirm the action before you use the reboot command, because this command may break down the network in a short period of time. In addition, before restarting a device, ensure that the configuration file of the device has been saved.
After the reboot command is run, if you do not respond to the prompt of the system before the time expires, the user view will be displayed and the device will not be restarted.
After the reboot command is run, press Ctrl+C to interrupt.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
Running the reboot command breaks down a network in a short time. Exercise caution when running the command.When the reboot command is run, the system does not prompt you whether to save diagnostic information. Diagnostic information is not saved.After the reboot command is run, the system returns to the AP view and the AP does not restart if you do not respond to the system's message before the timer expires.
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
